uk.co.caprica.vlcj.runtime
Class RuntimeUtil

java.lang.Object
  uk.co.caprica.vlcj.runtime.RuntimeUtil

public class RuntimeUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Crude heuristics to determine the current Operating System.

The com.sun.jna.Platform class provides similar functionality.

Test whether the runtime operating system is "unix-like".

Returns:
true if the runtime OS is unix-like, Linux, Unix, FreeBSD etc

Test whether the runtime operating system is a Mac variant.

Returns:

safeLongToInt

public static int safeLongToInt(long value)
Try to safely convert a long value to an int. The current libvlc API requires a 32-bit integer value for the drawable window handle - however, according to the JNA API it is possible that 64-bit integer values are used (since Native.getComponentId returns a long value).

Therefore there is a chance that we are given a native window handle that we can not use with libvlc.

In practice, I have never seen this happen on Linux or Windows.

Parameters:
value - long value
Returns:
int value
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the long value can not be safely converted to an int
